intro: Solanum ciliatum var. multiflorum, commonly known as the multibracteate nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It features upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs and produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant's leaves are ovate with serrated edges and often have a fuzzy texture. After flowering, it develops small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
